items.description:
G'day everyone, welcome to issue #335 of Weekly Xamarin - an wrap-up of what's happening in the Xamarin and MAUI communities.

As we all settle into the new year, there has been a MAUI preview 12 release! Time to get stuck into that and investigate all the goodness.

Have a app-tastic week.

Kym
items.description_markdown:
G'day everyone, welcome to issue #335 of Weekly Xamarin - an wrap-up of what's happening in the Xamarin and MAUI communities.

As we all settle into the new year, there has been a MAUI preview 12 release! Time to get stuck into that and investigate all the goodness. 

Have a app-tastic week.

Kym

items.title: Edit Local Images/Text from a .NET MAUI Blazor Hybrid App
items.description:
With .NET 6 and the latest Visual Studio 2022 preview, developers can create a hybrid Blazor/.NET MAUI app that can work with local machines in ways that ordinary Blazor (web) apps can't.

Blazor code can now browse local file systems and open up local files and edit them in native Windows apps, for example.

Edit Local Images/Text from a .NET MAUI Blazor Hybrid App by David Ramel
items.description_markdown:
With .NET 6 and the latest Visual Studio 2022 preview, developers can create a hybrid Blazor/.NET MAUI app that can work with local machines in ways that ordinary Blazor (web) apps can't.

Blazor code can now browse local file systems and open up local files and edit them in native Windows apps, for example.

[**Edit Local Images/Text from a .NET MAUI Blazor Hybrid App**](https://visualstudiomagazine.com/articles/2022/01/18/blazor-hybrid.aspx) by [David Ramel](https://twitter.com/dramel)

embedded_links.title: **Edit Local Images/Text from a .NET MAUI Blazor Hybrid App**

items.title: Prism and Other Client Technologies with Brian Lagunas
items.description:
What's your UX strategy? Carl and Richard talk to Brian Lagunas about his work on Prism, the UX framework that works WPF, Xamarin, and now the Uno Platform to build good-looking, consistent UX experiences. Brian talks about the challenges around simplifying the UX experience enough to make it easy to do the right thing, while still having enough functionality to not limit what your applications can do. The conversation also dives into web UX challenges and some of the tools that Brian has been working on for Infragistics in the same space.

Prism and Other Client Technologies with Brian Lagunas by .NET Rocks!
items.description_markdown:
What's your UX strategy? Carl and Richard talk to Brian Lagunas about his work on Prism, the UX framework that works WPF, Xamarin, and now the Uno Platform to build good-looking, consistent UX experiences. Brian talks about the challenges around simplifying the UX experience enough to make it easy to do the right thing, while still having enough functionality to not limit what your applications can do. The conversation also dives into web UX challenges and some of the tools that Brian has been working on for Infragistics in the same space.

[**Prism and Other Client Technologies with Brian Lagunas**](https://www.dotnetrocks.com/default.aspx?ShowNum=1777) by [.NET Rocks!](https://dotnetrocks.com/)

embedded_links.title: **Prism and Other Client Technologies with Brian Lagunas**

items.title: .NET MAUI MVU With Comet: Getting Started in VS Code
items.description:
MVU (Model-View-Update) is a (new) design pattern that became popular because of SwiftUI and Flutter. Now it's also available for C# and .NET. More specifically, you can use it with .NET MAUI and build great cross-platform apps with it. Want to learn more and see how to get started? Watch this!

.NET MAUI MVU With Comet: Getting Started in VS Code by Gerald Versluis
items.description_markdown:
MVU (Model-View-Update) is a (new) design pattern that became popular because of SwiftUI and Flutter. Now it's also available for C# and .NET. More specifically, you can use it with .NET MAUI and build great cross-platform apps with it. Want to learn more and see how to get started? Watch this!

[**.NET MAUI MVU With Comet: Getting Started in VS Code**](https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=52RmT2MIFzg) by [Gerald Versluis](https://twitter.com/jfversluis)

embedded_links.title: **.NET MAUI MVU With Comet: Getting Started in VS Code**

items.title: Push Notifications: The Big Picture
items.description:
When I made the videos on how to implement push notifications, a lot of people had questions about how push notifications actually work. So I made a little video to talk about the logistics of push notifications; how they work and what to take into account. Hope this helps!

Push Notifications: The Big Picture by Gerald Versluis
items.description_markdown:
When I made the videos on how to implement push notifications, a lot of people had questions about how push notifications actually work. So I made a little video to talk about the logistics of push notifications; how they work and what to take into account. Hope this helps!

[**Push Notifications: The Big Picture**](https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=AKYebqOCAzY) by [Gerald Versluis](https://twitter.com/jfversluis)

items.title: Animating Controls in .NET MAUI & Xamarin.Forms
items.description:
Have you been looking to add some pizzaz to your .NET MAUI & Xamarin.Forms apps? Look no further than the built in animation system in these frameworks. You can easily add simple animations in code in just a few lines of code, you can chain multiple animations together, or create your own custom animation and synchronize it with your MVVM code.

Animating Controls in .NET MAUI & Xamarin.Forms by James Montemagno
items.description_markdown:
Have you been looking to add some pizzaz to your .NET MAUI & Xamarin.Forms apps? Look no further than the built in animation system in these frameworks. You can easily add simple animations in code in just a few lines of code, you can chain multiple animations together, or create your own custom animation and synchronize it with your MVVM code.

[**Animating Controls in .NET MAUI & Xamarin.Forms**](https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=48qN1h0DUjs) by [James Montemagno](https://twitter.com/jamesmontemagno)

items.title: Shell for .NET MAUI & Xamarin.Forms
items.description:
Today we look at exactly what Xamarin.Forms & .NET MAUI Shell are and why you may want to consider it for your application. We explain the history of shell, the structure it brings to your app, and features including simplified navigation with urls, and much more.

🐚 Shell for .NET MAUI & Xamarin.Forms - What, why, and how?!?! by James Montemagno
items.description_markdown:
Today we look at exactly what Xamarin.Forms & .NET MAUI Shell are and why you may want to consider it for your application. We explain the history of shell, the structure it brings to your app, and features including simplified navigation with urls, and much more.

[**🐚 Shell for .NET MAUI & Xamarin.Forms - What, why, and how?!?!**](https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=dM4PhZAUhzU) by [James Montemagno](https://twitter.com/jamesmontemagno)

embedded_links.title: **🐚 Shell for .NET MAUI & Xamarin.Forms - What, why, and how?!?!**
